abstract.value: Sandi L. Wisenberg, journalist and author, was a features writer for the <emph render="italic">Miami Herald</emph>, for which she wrote "Reds: A Generation of American Radicals Fads Away on Miami Beach" (July, 21, 1985). The collection contains Wisenberg's reseach files for "Reds: A Generation of Radicals Fades Away on Miami Beach," including files labeled with the first names of the individuals featured. The files include including notebooks, drafts, clippings and other printed ephemera, and a dozen audiocassettes, principally interviews with the subjects of her article.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Sandi L. Wisenberg Research Files; TAM 582; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

Sandi L. Wisenberg, journalist and author, was a features writer for the <emph render="italic">Miami Herald</emph>, for which she wrote "Reds: A Generation of American Radicals Fades Away on Miami Beach" (July, 21, 1985). Wisenberg also wrote <emph render="italic">Holocaust Girls: History, Memory and Other Obsessions</emph> (2002), and <emph render="italic">The Adventures of Cancer Bitch</emph> (2009). For more biographical information, see her website (http://slwisenberg.blogspot.com/).

The collection contains Wisenberg's reseach files for "Reds: A Generation of Radicals Fades Away on Miami Beach," including files labeled with the first names of the individuals featured. The files include notebooks, drafts, clippings and other printed ephemera. There are also a dozen audiocassettes, principally interviews with the subjects of her article.
